TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract MessageHeader extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaderInfo
Public MustInherit Class MessageHeader Inherits MessageHeaderInfo

Docs.summary: Represents the content of a SOAP header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A message header contains optional metadata that describe a message encapsulated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> class.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> can have zero or more headers that are used as an extension mechanism to pass information in messages that are application-specific. You can use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.Headers%2A> to add message headers to a message by calling the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders.Add%2A> method.
Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) provides a number of predefined message headers, as shown in the following table.
|Header Name|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |To|Contains the role that the message is targeting.| |Action|Provides a description of how the message should be processed.| |FaultTo|Contains the address of the node to which faults should be sent.| |From|Contains the address of the node that sent the message.| |Request|Indicates whether the message is a request.| |MessageID|Contains the unique ID of the message.| |RelatesTo|Contains the IDs of messages that are related to this message.| |ReplyTo|Contains the address of the node to which a reply should be sent for a request.|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the targeted recipient of the message header.
Docs.value: The targeted recipient of the message header. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is empty, the header is interpreted as targeted for the ultimate recipient of the message.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether this message header contains reference parameters of an endpoint reference.
Docs.value: if this message header contains reference parameters of an endpoint reference; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A reference parameter corresponds to the <`ReferenceParameters`> element described in the in the [WS-Addressing specification](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=96163).

.property instance bool MustUnderstand
Public Overrides ReadOnly Property MustUnderstand As Boolean
public: virtual property bool MustUnderstand { bool get(); };
member this.MustUnderstand : bool

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the header must be understood, according to SOAP 1.1/1.2 specification.
Docs.value: if the header must be understood; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is `true` and the message receiver cannot interpret the message header, the message is not processed and an exception is thrown. If this property is `false`, the receiver can ignore the message header and continue processing.
